qas.question: What attribute of the United States could be thought to lead more international and less domestic employment opportunities?

context: As of 2006, the iPod was produced by about 14,000 workers in the U.S. and 27,000 overseas. Further, the salaries attributed to this product were overwhelmingly distributed to highly skilled U.S. professionals, as opposed to lower skilled U.S. retail employees or overseas manufacturing labor. One interpretation of this result is that U.S. <a0_0>innovation<a0_0/> can create more jobs overseas than domestically.
